text: Hi <@U013134NBCK> thanks you! Unfortunately, again a feature that is only available after an upgrade :disappointed:

Hey everyone, which channel is used for asking questions about lead forms and lead form customisations (e.g. best practice for adding date range pickers which should output to two fields “from” and “to”)?

Hi All,
I am facing an issue with serverless api in HubSpot CMS.

I am calling a serverless API when a form is submitted in HubSpot CMS. One of the strangers got this flow by inspecting the browser and calling it as an API from one of their tools. It was like conitnously I got 950+ requests.

How can I avoid these things in future?

Thanks

Hey All,
I need to know if it’s possible to create a site using a paid theme in a developer sandbox account and if so how ?
You could try checking in the context.headers in your serverless function if the request is coming from your website or not

Hmmm, I've worked with customers to put HTML in a rich text inside CMS starter. Rich Text is a default module, so it should be available in starter templates. I've just done some testing in my starter portal as well and I am able to drag in a rich text with the Source Code feature. Could you DM me a picture of the results I am seeing. Rich Text should be available for the Starter ubscription.

You can sync themes between main and sandbox portals as long as they're associated. Definitely purchase it in PROD tho.

Also, transferring page builds themselves (not design assets, the drag and drop actual pages) is not seamless with sandbox unfortunately. So, if you're going to build in sandbox, be cognizant of that.

I have a contact ID and I'm trying to see what HubSpot lists the person is a part of.  I'm trying to use `request_contact.list_memberships`  -- how do I use that with a variable? For example my contact ID variable is `contact`

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hi. I am having some troubleshooting issues on a Landing Page with a Meeting Link embed. HubSpot Support suggested I come here for help. I am not a developer (my developer is unavailable until tomorrow). I cannot understand why the Start Booking button is not functioning on this page. Anyone here have suggestions on the next place for me to look to fix? <https://www.salesleap.com/meet?utm_campaign=Global%20-%20Outbound%20MQL&utm_medium=email&_hsmi=96908953&_hsenc=p2ANqtz--LdKBJHCkLHDN5zvbU_msrmB0YZdN6_otMJc20Dx9IowAPuEJQJknXjtXUF0VmBt_dUjlYm3BnSIHJCuT2MJ0zwEsemA&utm_content=96908953&utm_source=hs_automation|https://www.salesleap.com/meet?utm_campaign=Global%20-%20Outbound%20MQL&utm_medium=em[…]CuT2MJ0zwEsemA&utm_content=96908953&utm_source=hs_automation>

Hi, just joined this group and need a little direction regarding sequences and passing contact variables through links within those sequence emails.  We want to call an API endpoint and send in a variable through sequencing (<http://xxx.com/?FirstName={{contact.firstname}}&?Lastname={{contact.lastname}}|xxx.com/?FirstName={{contact.firstname}}&?Lastname={{contact.lastname}}>.  this works through Marketing emails but not sequencing emails.  Are there any work arounds?

:robot_face: A reminder that if you're going to try to provide answers using ChatGPT/any AI, you MUST first disclose that you are doing so. Too many GPT responses are incorrect and will steer folks in the wrong direction. It also goes against our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct#undisclosed-use-of-ai-in-questions-responses-or-conversations|Developer Slack Code of Conduct>. Thanks for the nudge, <@U01QVR44MEY> :robot_face:

If anyone suspects GPT usage, message me and mark it with :robot_face:

Humans helping humans until the robots take over!!!

AI is awesome but it just has a tendency to <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hallucination_(artificial_intelligence)#:~:text=In%20artificial%20intelligence%20(AI)%2C,justified%20by%20its%20training%20data.|hallucinate> when it doesn't know something for sure, usually it makes up endpoints, limits, instructions on how to do things (like create a workflow custom code action), or references links. Super useful but just make sure you double check it's output and make any necessary edits

Hey :wave:  Can anyone help me out with marketing forms, please?

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1683106211277189>

for this I always use third-party library and two hidden filed for start date and end date

when the range is selected, I update the value of respective hidden field.
<@U013134NBCK> can you clarify if you are referring to syncing between prod and sandbox for enterprise accounts? or if you mean that a developer sandbox can be connected to a prod account?

Hi <@UNWHHSWHJ>, thanks for your response.

But do you add another field the user can click on to be able to open the daterange picker in the first place?

And is this hidden field added in HubSpot or via JS on your site?

Oop, yes. So <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/sync-automated-emails-forms-lists-and-workflows-to-a-standard-sandbox-account|Enterprise Sandbox syncs theme and design assets through the sync ui>

in other cases, developing not in an enterprise sandbox, you can connect your testing environment to a prod account through proper authorizing via local dev. essentially being able to push and pull theme assets between a dev portal and prod. I may be unaware of some nuance swith the licensing and marketplace paid themes that may not allow its move between normal portals through CLI, as anyone with an Auth key for any given amount portals would be able to implement 1 paid theme into multiple that way.

two hidden filed can be added via form editor it self.

and the choice is yours for adding another field for allowing user to pickup a date range picker.

what I do generally is appending this picker to form using JS so I don’t have to use 3rd field.
<https://tamble.github.io/jquery-ui-daterangepicker/>
Thanks <@UNWHHSWHJ>! I will talk with our Developers about this again. :pray:
And you're trying to insert this into a link like this: <https://google.com|LINK> not just a normal verbatim link right?
Ok this is strange, but when I try to submit in full screen it doesn't work but if I make the page smaller it works fine
<https://www.loom.com/share/4bd230a1f6054c6091ce1579515144aa>
it appears the 1550px wide is what sets it off
Does anyone have a solution to reduce CLS on the HubSpot Chatbot? We have a chat on nearly every page and this element alone is pushing our CLS score into the red.
I see there’s a community post <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CRM/Live-Chat-Causing-CLS-Issues/m-p/421127|here>, but no resolve.
After running a couple of tests and checking around I don't think you can do this. even if you pull in the contact using `crm_object`  You can only get lists memberships if the contact is logged in
I thought as much too, I tried a few and gave up
didn't work for me
Yeah it feels like it should work though
funny thing is that list_memberships isn't an actual property
I ended up doing a roundabout way using crm_assocations
yeah was thinking the same thing
pretty resource intensive though if you want to pull multiple contacts on the same page

I found a solution, remove it :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

Yeah it's a real pain, I have never been able to figure it out
I wish I could! That and Lucky Orange, and Facebook Pixel, and AdRoll, and...you get where I'm going.
You could also store a simple variable outside of the main function that tracks the last request and makes sure the current one is different

Hey <@U01QVR44MEY>. Thanks for looking at this. Nice detective work :male-detective:.  Strange for sure. I hope to get my developers attention to see if they can fix. This is outside my realm of fixing
yeah I'm trying some things on my end but it's very strange
I think it has to do with the button just getting covered up by a hidden layer
Honestly this channel is pretty good as well as <#C2YH119N2|hubl>, <#CFPRTEGTX|modules> and <#CSFGKSHT7|themes>
CC <@U2LEJ045D> you've done this before right?
You definitely can import contacts into HubSpot from another system and set them as marketing contacts from a technical standpoint

That meeting module box extends down too far and always leaves a large dead space between it and the next section on the site. I think our developer did something to reduce that gap and maybe that is the issue.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/contacts/set-contacts-as-marketing>
you could also setup a form that can be sent from your existing system that would move that contact over to HubSpot as a marketing contact
So you're receiving one webhook for each property that is changed? is so that's how it's intended to work.
And if so what's the main issue that you're running into on your end we can possibly help you get that updated
So that value is what's called an epoc millisecond data. And you can convert it a number of ways but first how are you sending the whatsapp message? <http://Make.com|Make.com> Zapier?
Did you get this figured out?
you could make it look like one of these links: <http://google.com|LINK> would that work?
Yeah that's how this endpoint is supposed to function. This endpoint was designed for quickly getting objects not for syncs or exports
The best way to do what you want to do is to use the exports api in conjunction with a search filter <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/exports>
Thanks again. You are the man
Lol, yep. I feel ya
The limits on the search filter in the exports api is the same as in the search api (without the object limit of course)
of course bro, I'll let you know what I find
Unfortunately no this isn't really supported by HubSpot, you can completely disable the ability for certain users to touch certain property but you can't really limit based on criteria

Question.. I developed a quiz module for a client and it has 6 outcomes. Each outcome has either a meeting link scheduler or form embedded. The quiz works great but when looking at the page performance Google shows duplicate  javascript file bundles loading on the page. So each form or scheduler embed is the issue. I’ve try to set this up several different ways but I still have not found a solution so I don’t have the same js file loading multiple times. I’m not sure why HubSpot is loading it’s own files in multiple times. I’ve loaded multiple forms on a page before and have not had this issue. And I can’t find any documentation on it or find anything in the HubSpot community website about this issue.

Does anyone know a solution?
Hmm, Design Tools is giving me an error of `Error: Internal error` for a couple of theme files, and it’s preventing me from hiding or removing them. Any idea what might be up there?
